posts.name: Prince M
posts.cooked: For swerve turning we have a PG gearmotor from Andymark controlled by a Talon SRX. We use a separate analog absolute encoder ma3 connected from the motor to the rio to get its position (one to one ratio with 360 range and an offset). A conversion factor and gear ratio are not necessary since we directly use the absolute encoder (not attached to the Talon SRX). How do I set this up in YAGSL? Will YAGSL still work even though closed loop control will not work for the TalonSRX? Do I leave the conversion factor blank when configuring YAGSL and anything related to closed-loop control?

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: YAGSL doesn’t really care how you do it. You can plug it into the Rio and bypass the SRX entirely

posts.name: Prince M
posts.cooked: I’m worried that YAGSL may attempt to do some kind of closed-loop control internally and run into problems or some perpetual loop with a PID or get stuck waiting for a sensor input from the SRX etc…

I lightly tried something like this and it worked (I was using the example Mk4i Neo config). I haven’t read the code, so don’t quote me on this, but I suspect YAGSL is just initializing the integrated encoder to the absolute encoder position, so you’ll be running PID against your motor’s internal encoder, and will still want to configure closed loop control.

posts.name: Prince M
posts.cooked:
Sorry but I’m not sure I understand. The issue is that there is no integrated encoder, the talonSRX motor controller has no encoder data connected to it whatsoever. I did some digging through the code and it seems like my configuration will not work on a real robot (simulation works fine).

The code in YAGSL uses position control mode on the talonSRX for angle motors which is a closed-loop control method on the motor controller which requires an integrated encoder to function. There does not seem to be a way to use an absolute encoder for closed-loop control on the talonSRX in YAGSL. I highly doubt this will work on a real robot with my configuration (I have not tested).

TalonSRX with absolute encoders attached to them are not tested yet and because of this the PR is not merged. Here is the PR and if you test it and it works I will gladly merge it!

Add support to Talon SRX for an integrated absolute encoder BroncBotz3481:dev ← WispySparks:srx-abs opened 08:00PM - 17 May 24 UTC WispySparks +85 -0

First time working around the codebase, I went this route because I don't think … you can really have a reference to a talon's sensor like you can with revlib. Not sure if this all looks right
